com.developmentontheedge.beans

Class Option

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.developmentontheedge.beans.Option
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertyChangeObservable, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Column, ColumnModel, PropertiesDPS

    public class Option
extends Object
implements Serializable, PropertyChangeObservable
    This class implements generic approach for propagating PropertyChangeEvent from children to parent. Suppose class A contains option B and B has nested options C1, C2, C3, so B is parent for C1, C2, C3. Let's L will be PropertyChangeListener of A. Then, if some of the children options C1, C2 or C3 is changed, it will notify its listener and parent listeners as well (i.e. L).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public void addPropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener l)

        public void removePropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener l)

      • firePropertyChange

        protected void firePropertyChange(PropertyChangeEvent evt)
        Reports a bound property update to any registered listeners. No event is fired if old and new values are equal and non-null.
        Parameters:
        evt - the PropertyChangeEvent object.
        PENDING:
        for propagation PropertyChangeEvent should be created more accurately

      • firePropertyChange

        protected void firePropertyChange(String propertyName,
                                  Object oldValue,
                                  Object newValue)
        Reports a bound property update to any of the registered listeners. No event is fired if old and new values are equal and non-null.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - programmatic name of the property that was changed.
        oldValue - old value of the property.
        newValue - new value of the property.

      • firePropertyChange

        protected void firePropertyChange(String propertyName,
                                  boolean oldValue,
                                  boolean newValue)
        Reports a bound property update for a boolean property to any of the registered listeners. No event is fired if old and new values are equal and non-null. This is merely a convenience wrapper around the more general firePropertyChange method that takes Object values.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - programmatic name of the property that was changed.
        oldValue - old value of the property.
        newValue - new value of the property.

      • firePropertyChange

        protected void firePropertyChange(String propertyName,
                                  int oldValue,
                                  int newValue)
        Reports a bound property update for a integer property to any of the registered listeners. No event is fired if old and new values are equal and non-null. This is merely a convenience wrapper around the more general firePropertyChange method that takes Object values.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - programmatic name of the property that was changed.
        oldValue - old value of the property.
        newValue - new value of the property.

      • firePropertyChange

        protected void firePropertyChange(String propertyName,
                                  double oldValue,
                                  double newValue)
        Reports a bound property update for a double property to any of the registered listeners. No event is fired if old and new values are equal and non-null. This is merely a convenience wrapper around the more general firePropertyChange method that takes Object values.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - programmatic name of the property that was changed
        oldValue - old value of the property
        newValue - new value of the property

      • getNameInParent

        public String getNameInParent()
        Returns:
        the nameInParent nameInParent is the bean property name in parent object to access this object Thus when nameInParent is set, option.getParent().findProperty(option.getNameInParent()).getValue() must return option
